title: Completing the Square
text: To complete the square of a quadratic function $$f(x)=a x^2+b x+c$$, first you need to find the greatest common multiple between a,b such that $$f(x)=d \left(\frac{a}{d} x^2+\frac{b}{d} x\right)+c$$.
speech: To complete the square of a quadratic function  f of x is equal to a x squared, plus b x plus c , first you need to find the greatest common multiple between a,b such that  f of x is equal to d parentheses a over d, x squared, plus b over d, x  plus c .

, first you need to find the greatest common multiple between a,b such that   f of x is equal to d  a over d, x squared, plus b over d, x  plus c

title: Completing the Square
text: To find the value to add to $$f(x)=a \left(x^2+b x\right)+c$$, you must add $${\left(\frac{b}{2}\right)}^2$$ within the parantheses. To do so, you must multiply the result by a.

title: Finding the Range
text: The range of the function $$f(x)=-3{\left(x-1\right)}^2+10$$ can be found by breaking the function into parts.
speech: The range of the function  f of x is equal to negative 3 times, parentheses x minus 1,  squared plus 10  can be found by breaking the function into parts.

title: Finding the Range

subHints.title: Range of $${\left(x+a\right)}^2$$
subHints.text: The range of $${\left(x+a\right)}^2$$ will be $$[0,\infty)$$. a will only shift the equation left and right, changing the domain but not the range.

title: Finding the Range

subHints.title: Range of $$-f(x)$$
subHints.text: The range [a,b] for the function f(x) will be $$[-b,-a]$$ for the function $$-f(x)$$.

title: Finding the Range

subHints.title: Range of $$f{\left(x\right)}+c$$
